post.summary:
InvalidateCache empties the page cache of the given site identifier. This call invalidates the cache entries for
the static pages of a Website site. Note that this call also empties the object cache of a Website site, and
invalidates the CDN. Invalidating the object cache means emptying the CloudSQL cached calls, which will make the
site issue all of its database queries to the database. Invalidating the CDN means that the static files of the
site will have to be re-cached in the CDN of Website
IsCDNEnabled enables a caller to find whether the Website CDN caching is enabled for a site or not
IsObjectCacheEnabled enables a caller to find out whether Object Cache is enabled for a site or not
SetCDN enables a site to serve static files from the Website CDN, where static files are cached

SetObjectCache sets the object cache field of a site to the given true/false value. Setting object cache to true
allows Website sites to cache CloudSQL calls, rather than hit the CloudSQL instance for every single query that a
website has to perform.

GetAttributes allows a caller to ask for the value of multiple options/fields for a site identified by the
given site ID
GetGoogleAnalyticsTrackingID informs a caller of the currently set Google Analytics tracking ID of a site
GetPHPVersion informs the caller of whether site runs with PHP 7 or 8
GetSiteResourceUsagesAttributes returns the resource usages of the site associated with the given site ID
GetStagingPHPVersion informs the caller of whether site runs with PHP 7 or 8
IsDeactivated informs the caller of whether the site identified by the given site ID is deactivated or not
IsGoogleAnalyticsEnabled informs the caller of whether the Google Analytics field is enabled or disabled for a given site
IsMultiSiteEnabled informs the caller of whether a site is a multi-site or not
IsSkipUpgradeHTTPEnabled informs the caller of whether skip upgrade HTTP is enabled or not for the given site
IsStagingEnabled informs the caller of whether the staging environment of a site is enabled or not
IsTemplate allows a caller to check whether the site identified by the given site ID is a template or not
IsWPDebugEnabled informs the caller of whether the WP debug field of a site is enabled or not
IsWPLoginExposed informs the caller of whether the WP login exposed field is enabled or disabled for a given site

SetAccountID allows a caller to set the account ID of the site identified by the given site ID to the
account ID specified in the request

SetAccountIdentifier allows a caller to set both the account ID and partner ID of the site identified by the given
site ID, to the account ID and partner ID specified in the request

SetEditionID allows a caller to set the edition ID of the site identified by the site ID specified
in the request
SetGoogleAnalyticsEnabled allows a caller to set the Google Analytics Enabled/Disabled for the site ID specified

SetGoogleAnalyticsTrackingID sets the Google Analytics tracking ID of the given site. The tracking ID is injected
into the index page of a site, which allows website owners to track their site's traffic in Google Analytics

SetMultiSite allows a caller to set the multi-site field of a site. Using this requires additional work to support
multiple sub-domains for a site
SetPHPVersion allows the caller to set the PHP version for the site to be 7 or 8.

SetSkipUpgradeHTTP allows the caller to set the value of skip upgrade HTTP to enabled or disabled (true/false).
Setting the skip to true forces a site to serve its content over HTTPS using the SSL certificate that is obtained
for the given site. Enforcing this is sometimes required because site databases will have static file links encoded
as HTTP, rather than HTTPS
SetStaging enables the staging environment of the given site identifier
SetStagingPHPVersion allows the caller to set the PHP version for the site to be 7 or 8.
SetSubsiteInfoInRedis method is to store subsitesite info in redis

SetWPDebug allows callers to set the WP debug field of a site to enabled or disabled. Having the field enabled
makes a site echo its PHP errors at the top of the page that errors occur on, which facilitates debugging

SetWPLoginExposed allows the caller to set the exposure of the WP login page to true or false. Exposing WP login
may expose a site to security vulnerabilities because of DDOS attacks to that page, specifically, as it is a
popular login page that not many sites change
SetWpOption allows a caller to set the wp option value of the site identified by the site ID specified

AddAlternateDomain allows the caller to add an alternate domain to the site identified by the ID that is passed
in the request to the endpoint
Create allows a caller to create the site given in the request
Deactivate allows a caller to deactivate the Site associated with the given site ID
Delete allows a caller to delete a site based on the given site identifier - site ID

DeleteAlternateDomain allows the caller to delete an alternate domain of the site identified by the ID that is
passed in the request to the endpoint
DowngradeSite sets default domain as primary domain and deletes all alternate domains

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
DowngradeSiteRequest is the structure of the request to the DowngradeSite endpoint.
contains the id of the site to set its default domain as primary and delete all other domains.

post.summary: Get returns the Site associated with the site ID present on the request message
GetSiteIDFromDomain informs the caller about the site ID associated with the domain of a site

List allows a caller to iterate over all the stored sites. List takes in a cursor as part of the request, which
allows the caller to specify what "page" of all the sites to return. In addition, the endpoint takes in a page
size, which allows the caller to specify the number of sites to return at a time. Note that the response of the
List endpoint contains several parts: (1) a list of valid sites, which contains Site objects, (2) a list of invalid
site IDs, which are sites the endpoint iterated over, but found them to be invalid, and (3) the next cursor, if
there are any more sites to iterate over. The endpoint marks sites as invalid if it was not able to perform a Get
for them in the process of assembling the valid_sites field
Reactivate allows a caller to reactivate the Site associated with the given site ID

SetPrimaryDomain sets the primary domain of the site specified by the ID in the request payload to the domain that
is also specified in the request

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: SetPrimaryDomainRequest is the structure of the request to the SetPrimaryDomain endpoint.

v1AddAlternateDomainRequest.title:
AddAlternateDomainRequest is the structure of the request to the AddAlternateDomain endpoint. The message contains
the ID of the site to add the alternate domain to, along with the alternate domain to add

v1CreateRequest.title: CreateRequest is the message structure for creating a site

v1DeactivateRequest.title: DeactivateRequest is the request containing the identifier of the site to be deactivated

v1DeleteAlternateDomainRequest.title:
DeleteAlternateDomainRequest is the structure of the request to the DeleteAlternateDomain endpoint. The message
contains the ID of the site to delete the given alternate domain from

v1DeleteRequest.title: DeleteRequest allows structuring a request for deleting the site identified by the site ID

v1DowngradeSiteRequest.description:
DowngradeSiteRequest is the structure of the request to the DowngradeSite endpoint.
contains the id of the site to set its default domain as primary and delete all other domains.

v1GetAttributesRequest.title: GetAttributesRequest allows the caller to specify the fields to get from a site identified by the given site ID

v1GetAttributesResponse.title: GetAttributesResponse informs the caller of the values of the fields requested for a site identified by a site ID

siteId.title: The site ID of the site

phpVersion.title: the value the flag is set to

v1GetSiteIDFromDomainRequest.title: GetSiteIDFromDomainRequest is the message that allows the caller to request a site ID based on the domain of the site

v1GetSiteIDFromDomainResponse.title: GetSiteIDFromDomainResponse is the response containing the site ID mapped from the domain of the request

v1GetSiteRequest.title: GetSiteRequest allows structure a request for getting a Site based on the site ID

v1GetSiteResourceUsagesAttributesRequest.title: GetSiteResourceUsagesAttributesRequest allows the caller to specify the fields to get from a site identified by the given site ID

v1GetSiteResourceUsagesAttributesRespons.title: GetSiteResourceUsagesAttributesResponse informs the caller of the values of the fields requested for a site identified by a site ID

v1GetSiteResponse.title: GetSiteResponse contains the response for getting a site based on the site ID

siteId.title: The site ID of the site

stagingPhpVersion.title: the value the flag is set to

v1GetTrackingIDRequest.title:
GetTrackingIDRequest allows the caller to obtain the currently set Google Analytics tracking ID of a site. The Google
Analytics tracking ID is the identifier that is injected into the WordPress instance of a Website site

v1GetTrackingIDResponse.title:
GetTrackingIDResponse gives the caller the Google Analytics tracking ID that is injected into the WordPress
instance of a given Website site

v1InvalidateCacheRequest.title: InvalidateCacheRequest supports invalidating the cache of a site

v1IsCDNEnabledRequest.title: IsCDNEnabledRequest supports getting the value of the CDN field of the given site

v1IsCDNEnabledResponse.title: IsCDNEnabledResponse informs the caller about whether or not the CDN of a site is enabled

v1IsDeactivatedRequest.title: IsDeactivatedRequest allows the caller to check whether a site is deactivated by specifying the site ID

v1IsDeactivatedResponse.title: IsDeactivatedResponse informs the caller of whether a specified site, identified by a site ID, is deactivated

v1IsGoogleAnalyticsEnabledRequest.title: IsGoogleAnalyticsEnabledRequest allows the caller to ask whether GA for the site is Enabled or not (true/false)

v1IsGoogleAnalyticsEnabledResponse.title: IsGoogleAnalyticsEnabledResponse informs the caller of whether GA for the site is Enabled or not (true/false)

v1IsMultiSiteEnabledRequest.title: IsMultiSiteEnabledRequest allows the caller to ask for the value of the multi-site field of a site

v1IsMultiSiteEnabledResponse.title: IsMultiSiteEnabledResponse informs the caller of whether the multi-site field of a site is enabled or not

v1IsObjectCacheEnabledRequest.title: IsObjectCacheEnabledRequest supports getting the value of the ObjectCache field

v1IsObjectCacheEnabledResponse.title: IsObjectCacheEnabledResponse informs the caller of whether Object Cache is enabled for a given site

v1IsSkipUpgradeHTTPEnabledRequest.title:
IsSkipUpgradeHTTPEnabledRequest allows the caller to ask for the skip upgrade HTTP field and find whether it is enabled
or not

v1IsSkipUpgradeHTTPEnabledResponse.title: IsSkipUpgradeHTTPEnabledResponse informs the caller of whether the skip upgrade HTTP is enabled or not

v1IsStagingEnabledRequest.title: IsStagingEnabledRequest allows the caller to ask whether the staging environment of a site is enabled or not

v1IsStagingEnabledResponse.title: IsStagingEnabledResponse informs the caller of whether the staging environment of a site is enabled or not

v1IsTemplateRequest.title: IsTemplateRequest allows the caller to check whether the site identified by the given site ID is a template or not

v1IsTemplateResponse.title: IsTemplateResponse is the response that informs whether a site is a template or not

v1IsWPDebugEnabledRequest.title: IsWPDebugEnabledRequest allows the caller to get the currently set value for the WP debug field of a site

live.title: indicator of whether the live site has WP debug enabled

staging.title: indicator of whether the staging site has WP debug enabled

v1IsWPDebugEnabledResponse.title: IsWPDebugEnabledResponse informs the caller of whether the WP debug field of a site is enabled or not

v1IsWPLoginExposedRequest.title: IsWPLoginExposedRequest allows the caller to ask whether WP login is exposed or not (true/false)

v1IsWPLoginExposedResponse.title: IsWPLoginExposedResponse informs the caller of whether WP login is set to exposed or not (true/false)

v1ListRequest.title:
ListRequest is the structure of the request that is passed to the List endpoint. It contains a cursor, which
specifies the "page" to return, and a page size that dictates how many sites to return per List call

v1ListResponse.title:
ListResponse is the structure of the List endpoint response. It contains a list of sites that are returned per List
call, for the corresponding cursor and page size that are passed through the request

v1ReactivateRequest.title: ReactivateRequest is the request containing the identifier of the site to be reactivated

v1SetAccountIDRequest.title: SetAccountIDRequest is the structure of the message that contains the site ID for which a new account ID can be set

v1SetAccountIdentifierRequest.title: SetAccountIdentifierRequest is the structure of the message that contains the site ID for which a new account ID and partner ID can be set

v1SetCDNRequest.title: SetCDNRequest supports setting the CDN field of a site to enabled or disabled (true/false)

v1SetEditionIDRequest.title: SetEditionIDRequest is the structure of the message that contains the site ID for which a new edition can be set

v1SetGoogleAnalyticsEnabledRequest.title: SetGoogleAnalyticsEnabledRequest is the structure of the message that contains the site ID and key for which a new value can be set

v1SetMultiSiteRequest.title: SetMultiSiteRequest allows the caller to enable or disable a site as a multi-site (site with subdomains)

v1SetObjectCacheRequest.title: SetObjectCacheRequest supports setting the object cache field of the given site to enabled or disabled (true/false)

siteId.title: The site ID of the site to set the expose wp login flag

phpVersion.title: the value to set the flag to

v1SetPrimaryDomainRequest.description: SetPrimaryDomainRequest is the structure of the request to the SetPrimaryDomain endpoint.

v1SetSkipUpgradeHTTPRequest.title: SetSkipUpgradeHTTPRequest allows the caller to set the skip upgrade HTTP field of a site

siteId.title: The site ID of the site to set the expose wp login flag

stagingPhpVersion.title: the value to set the flag to

dbName.title: the db_name represents the name of the staging database to be used

v1SetStagingRequest.title: SetStagingRequest allows the caller to set the staging value of a site to enabled or disabled (true/false)

v1SetSubSiteInfoRequest.title: SetSubSiteInfoRequest allows the caller to subsite information in redis

v1SetTrackingIDRequest.title:
SetTrackingIDRequest allows the caller to set the Google Analytics tracking ID for a site. This is the tracking ID
that is injected into the WordPress instance of a Website site

v1SetWPDebugRequest.title: SetWPDebugRequest allows the caller to set the value of the WP debug field to enabled or not (true/false)

v1SetWPLoginExposedRequest.title: SetWPLoginExposedRequest allows a caller to specify whether WP login should be exposed for a site

v1SetWpOptionRequest.title: SetWpOptionRequest is the structure of the message that contains the site ID and key for which a new value can be set

id.title: ID represents the unique 64 characters identifier of the site

uid.title: UID is the unique identifier of the site

domain.title: domain is the primary domain of the site

alternateDomains.title: alternate_domains is a list of alternate domains for the site

dbName.title: db_name is the main database name of the site from CloudSQL

dbHost.title: db_host is the IP of the CloudSQL database of the site

dbUser.title: db_user is the main user of the database

dbPass.title: db_pass is the password of the main user of the database

stagingDbName.title: staging_db_name is the database name for the staging instance of the site

stagingDomain.title: staging_domain is the primary domain of the staging site

userId.title: user_id is the identifier of the user performing site actions

mountPath.title: mount_path is the filesystem mount path where the site files are located

editionId.title: edition_id is the edition indicator, express (has an ID) or pro

wpDebugEnabled.title: wp_debug_enabled is the boolean indicator of whether WP debug is enabled or not

stagingWpDebugEnabled.title: staging_wp_debug_enabled is the boolean indicator of whether WP debug is enabled or not for a site

cdnVersion.title: cdn_version is the version of the CDN for the site

objectCacheVersion.title: object_cache_version is the version of the object cache, similar to CDN

deactivated.title: deactivated is an indicator of whether the site is deactivated

template.title: template is an indicator of whether the site is a template or not

ignoreCacheHeaders.title:
ignore_cache_headers is an indicator of whether the cache headers of requests issued to the site identified
by the site ID should be ignored

gaTrackingId.title: ga_tracking_id is the Google Analytics tracking ID injected into the site to be used for GA traffic tracking

skipUpgradingHttp.title: skip_upgrading_http is an indicator of whether the site should skip upgrading HTTP requests to HTTPS

exposeWpLogin.title: expose_wp_login is a boolean indicator of whether the site should expose its WP Login page

multiSite.title: multi_site is an indicator of whether the site is a multi-site (structured with subdomains)

version.title: version is used for versioning sites that are templates (template = true)

phpVersion.title: PHP version used for running the site

wpOption.title: WpOption allows a caller to set the wp option value of the site identified by the site ID specified

googleAnalyticsEnabled.title: GoogleAnalyticsEnabled is used for enabling/Disabling the GoogleANalytics by the siteID specified

stagingPhpVersion.title: Staging PHP version used for running the site

isObjectCache.title: Redis object cache enable/disable via support tools

subsites.title: subsite_info contains subsite details for multi_site

developerModeEnabled.title: Enable developer mode toggle in support tools

v1Site.title: Site is the canonical representation of a site

v1SiteType.title: SiteType is an enum that indicates the types of sites that options can be set on

blogId.description: blog_id represents the unique integer id of the subsite.

blogName.title: blog_name represents the title description of the subsite added by user

path.title: path represents the path of the subsite in url after domain
